sage.texture

Class Texture2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.texture.Texture
      • sage.texture.Texture2D

  • public class Texture2D
extends Texture
    Texture2D subclasses Texture to represent a concrete 2D texture.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Detail

      • createSimpleClone

        public Texture createSimpleClone()
        Returns a clone of this Texture2D. Note that not all data in this Texture2D object is duplicated in the clone; specifically, image data is shared.
        Specified by:
        createSimpleClone in class Texture

      • createSimpleClone

        public Texture createSimpleClone(Texture rVal)
        Returns a clone of this Texture2D, storing the cloned values in the specified Texture object. The return value is a reference to the input object. The input object must not be null.
        Overrides:
        createSimpleClone in class Texture
        Returns:
        a Texture which is a clone of this Texture

      • setWrapMode

        public void setWrapMode(Texture.WrapAxis axis,
                        Texture.WrapMode mode)
        setWrapMode() sets the wrap mode of this texture for a particular axis.
        Specified by:
        setWrapMode in class Texture
        Parameters:
        axis - the texture axis to define a wrapmode on.
        mode - the wrap mode for the given axis of the texture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if axis or mode are null

      • getType

        public Texture.TextureType getType()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Description copied from class: Texture
        Returns an indication of whether this Texture equals the specified Texture. Equality is defined by comparing a number of texture attributes including:
        • textureId
        • image (the Image object associated with the Texture)
        • anisotropic filtering percentage
        • applyMode mode
        • combine functions and operations
        • environment map mode
        • magnification and minification filters
        • blend mode
        All of the above attributes must be equal for the Textures to be considered equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Texture
